title: Do people with COVID-19 have HIV also? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Completely unrelated. But some people that do have HIV can still get coronavirus. The body's immune system can defeat coronavirus within 2 months if they can be kept alive. But a person with HIV will carry the virus for the rest of their life. It may take a year before HIV causes problems. A person with coronavirus may become sick between one or two weeks after infection. Many people will have few or no symptoms of coronavirus. Over 90% of people survive. Everyone with AIDS will die. Mainly from the infection unless they die in some other event. The coronavirus and HIV come from very different regions. HIV most likely comes from primates in Africa. Coronavirus may come from bats in China. HIV/AIDS kills hundreds of thousands of people each year. It is a very slow but deadly disease. Most deaths are in Africa. It is likely that coronavirus will have mostly died out in 2 years' time. For a number of reasons. There are still many things we do not know about these 2 viruses. Despite intensive research.

I suspect that there would be people with covid-19 who also have HIV, yes. The former has spread across a wide enough swathe of the global population that it’s sure to have infected at least one person who has the latter. That said, a lot of people with HIV know that they’re immunocompromised as it is, so they may be more likely to have self-isolated where possible. It would be the developing world where that may not be the case. If the meaning of the question is “Does being infected by covid-19 cause someone to be infected with HIV as well?”, though, the answer is no. They’re two separate viruses.
These are two distinct diseases and there is no more reason to link them than to ask if people with measles have HIV, or if people with diabetes have HIV, etc.
They could. I am not aware of any personally, but there are lots of HIV/AIDS Patients out there many asymptomatic.
